reviewText: An enjoyable and lovingly platformer with quite a few secrets and cute things to discover.\nThe gameplay is simple, basically just one all purpose button, yet it feels good with stuff like wall jumping (/ kicking), double jump boots and the like. Somewhat reminds me of the old NES Super Mario Bros, which is a good thing.

reviewText:
It's alright.

The First Level's Difficulty is fine, but what I though were the checkpoints didn't let me respawn when I lost my health, but they always brought me back when I fell so I don't know if the checkpoints are confused about what they're meant to do or if they only let you respawn on falling down a pit.

But it's a pretty fun game and I wanted to keep going through the level every time I ended up dying.

Graphics are Really nice and pixely and they sit well with me.

Overall I'd recommend it, it's a pretty fun game and for 4 dollars, it's enough to keep your attention for a little while.

However I recommend d-pad mode, the normal mode the game was made with in mind is highly boring and is really not a good mode to start with if your just starting the game.

reviewText: Enjoyable little game. Some of the instructions are a bit funny. To enable xbox controller support, Press Ctrl + Y and move all the checkmarks to joypad. To fullscreen press 3. To make the game not an autorunner, change the controls to dpad. The controls feel a little bit floaty, but overall I enjoy the game and the writing. Characters are snarky and you get achievements for lots of random things. Such as inspecting poo. lol\n\nAll and all, not the next Mario but a fun way to waste a couple of hours when you are bored. OST is bright and cheery.

reviewText:
Now this was a nice surprise. This game just came out not too long ago and I honestly never would have found it if it wasn't bundled with some other games.

It is a wonderful little game with a lot of character. I don't see a lot of gameplay time in it because it seems like a small game but it has definitely gotten some laughs out of me. I think that's why I really play games, to enjoy myself and maybe get a few laughs. This definitely is delivering that and I can already see it giving me a few hours of fun. I'm not sure if the developers plan on expanding so don't expect a game with tons of hours of gameplay, go in and just see the world for yourself.

Now, for the actual game. The best way to describe this game is a hilarious, stupid Super Mario knockoff, and I mean that in the best way possible. Much of the gameplay resembles the original Mario games, with a few slight twists here and there. The art, the characters, the music, the secrets, the stupid jokes, THAT is why this is actually a good game. It's very ridiculous and maybe I have a stupid sense of humor but I find this game extremely funny.

All that being said, should you buy this game? I say yes, it is definitely worth $5 for a few hours of entertainment. I could see this probably going on sale eventually so if a couple bucks make the difference then wait. If not, buy this game, it might surprise you.
